name: Zlatni Rat Beach Hotel

reviews.text: 1 minute walk away from the lovely beach. Very large rooms. Spotlessly clean. Daily maid service. Free wifi, stereo. International TV channels. Basic decor but with good varied lighting. On site restaurant and bar (find out closing times, as it was closed in the evenings in late Sept.). Basic breakfast. A very scenic 20 minute walk to town. Free shuttle to Bol ferry port or bus station on departure. Best of all was Ivana, the Hotel Manager who was extremely attentive and helpful
reviews.title: Great for the beach

reviews.text: What an awesome find this hotel was. Felt more like private apartments than a hotel really as the rooms were around a little courtyard at the back just off the main promenade and each had their own doorway and outside area. Perfect place to spent my time of Brac during my solo backpacking tour of Croatia. Breakfast buffet was standard and good value, and the hotel staff were fantastic - would go out there way to make sure everything was great for you. They even arranged the pick up of my catamaran ticket to Split so that i didn't need to make the trip along the promenade into Bol to get it when I could be sunbathing on the beach! :) Brilliant. The girl on reception was super friendly and really really helpful - I arrived really early in the morning but they were more than eager to get me checked in and settled into my room as quickly as possible. I had dinner on the promenade here one night - just a pizza but it was great too. Really couldn't fault this place. Best location out there for Zlatni Rat beach and a lovely stroll along the promenade (about 15mins walk) to get into Bol for the evenings. I would go back here in an instant! Absolutely adored Brac island and Zlatni Rat Beach Hotel.
reviews.title: Brilliant location for Zlatni Rat beach - super service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located withing steps from Zlatni Rat beach, which makes it very convenient if beach is the main objective. It offers spacious apartments/rooms where simplicity dominates. There is not much to say about the place other than simple and good value.
reviews.title: Good for beach experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used one taxi to get from Bol's center to the hotel and from the hotel to Supetar for which we paid 70 and 350 kunas, respectively. We were subsequently informed that we got a good deal. There is also a water taxi that operates until 7:00 p.m. (Zlatni Rat beach <--> Bol's center) which costs 10 kunas per person.
reviews.title: What an amazing find - we loved it

reviews.text: Something to keep in mind. Breakfast offers poor choices. Also, the property is relatively far from the center where all restaurants and shops are located.
reviews.title: What a great find! The best location - only steps from the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Overall fine but had some problems

reviews.text: Location: excellent for the beach (5 minute walk). Longer walk into town on lovely promenade (about 15-20 minutes). 150 kunas (20 euros) to rent 2 loungers & 1 parasol (50 kunas each). Free shuttle to/from the harbour. And if arriving in Supetar, just catch one of the shared mini-vans instead of the bus - fast, comfortable, cheap.
reviews.title: Perfect location for Zlatni Rat beach

reviews.text: Breakfast: Standard fare. Pancakes were nice. Croissants run out quickly.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: Very disappointing experience. The first room we were in did not look like any of the pictures on booking.com (we were a corner unit in the gardens) but it was fine. However the shower would flood and there was no hot water. We complained about the hot water and were told it was due to use at peak times (insert eye roll since I used the shower at multiple different times including 2am). We checked with other units and none of them had hot water either. A few absurd reasons later and they finally admitted the hot water tank servicing the garden rooms was broken and after my husband complained numerous times they finally moved us to a sea view room (serviced by different tanks so no more issues with hot water and I could finally clean myself). Didn't appreciate the excuses from front-desk staff, but they were fine other than that. And as others have said the sea view rooms have no sea views, but they are a little more spacious and do look like the pictures on booking.com (although we did catch a glimpse of a couple rooms on the garden side and their's matched the website, so apparently just our room was a bit more plain).Oh - our fridge in the first room also didn't work, they tried to fix and couldn't, so they replaced it with this huge, loud, ugly fridge which we unplugged since the noise kept us up at night.
reviews.title: Good location for beach, nice rooms, but difficult to describe this place
Location, but...
reviews.text: Overall: The hot water issues, fridge problem, and unhelpful service regarding the hot water left a sour taste in my mouth about this place. Had we only stayed in the second room I would've really enjoyed my stay. Not sure I'd come back since I don't like hit and miss places.

Although there was only 1 person at reception and we had to wait 15 minutes for them to show someone to their room, the staff are pretty friendly and the hotel bar has cocktails in to-go cups for your walk into the old town. Perfect location for beach time. A five minute walk along the promenade towards town finds a bike rental to explore Brac. Very clean modern rooms with kettle for coffee & tea. Restaurant food was average but the staff there were very kind and friendly. I would stay here again or maybe opt to be closer to the center of town where it is a bit more lively at night and save the 25 minute walk to the beach for morning.
reviews.title: Good location to pebble beach
If you want to stay closest to Zlatni Rat & enjoy best service!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Zlatni Rat for two nights which turned into three. We were wanting to stay as close as possible to the famous beach so you couldn't beat the location. It's about a 20-30 minute walk to town but it is along a very scenic boulevard which is beautiful and nice way to finish an evening meal and gelato!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the hotel were amazing, thank you Ana and Ivana for looking after us. They arranged pick up and drop off from our catamaran and everything we needed was taken care of. When we left Bol, we went onto Hvar then Korcula but loved Bol so much we phoned Ivana to see if she could find us a room for four nights and whilst they were quite heavily booked, she shuffled things around and made it happen - thank you so much!
reviews.title: Amazing - best place we stayed in Croatia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So all in all, we stayed 7 nights at Zlatni Rat hotel in an apartment and a standard room, both were equally as good as each other. Breakfasts were adequate and meal options for lunch and dinner were also good.
reviews.title: Can't wait to return!

reviews.text: We would definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking at spending most of your time at the beach!
reviews.title: Phenomenal!!

aka: Zlatni Rat Beach Hotel Bol, Croatia - Brac Island
description: Zlatni Rat Beach Resort offers spacious, elegant accommodation a stone’s throw away from Zlatni Rat beach. Each room has either a balcony with sea-view or a garden view, complimentary Wi-Fi, flat-screen satellite TV, bathroom toiletries, fridge and safe. Suites also include a lounge area and kitchen. The hotel is adjacent to Veranda Restaurant & Cocktail Bar, the only restaurant and cocktail bar to offer spectacular views over Zlatni Rat. Your breakfast is served here. Ideally located for anyone wanting to spend their days on Zlatni Rat beach with all its facilities including a waterpark, a children’s play area, trampolines, paddle boat hire, a buffet and an a la carte restaurant, a couple of beach bars and a number of stalls selling snacks and refreshments. Zlatni Rat Beach Hotel is connected to Bol’s town centre by a tree-lined promenade along which you will find more beaches, various nautical sports centres (windsurfing, diving, kiteboarding, kayaking, sailing), several tennis centre, a bike hire centre, a beach volleyball court, a cocktail bar, a children’s fun park, a beach restaurant and several beach bars.  The centre of Bol can also be reached easily by public transport (road train, taxi boat from Zlatni Rat beach or taxi) from just outside the hotel. Our guests can also rent bicycles to get into town and to explore the picturesque surroundings.Zlatni Rat Beach Hotel also has its own private parking facilities.
